--- Curran Campbell <neobliviscar@...> wrote:
> Vern & Robert,
> 
> I figured someone would comment with more knowledge
> than me. But I'll try and further discussion on it.
> Those with more knowledge ___PLEASE___correct me.
> 
> Very -off the cuff- impression is it was later
> Shinto
> or Shinshinto shortened to fit WW II mounts. Little
> guess as to school. I have much to learn about
> ShinShinto.
>   I don't know much either about WWII mounts, so not
> sure how much that would trim. Would move the machi
> up
> considerably and leave a bright nakago mune behind?
> Does seem to my eye to have tobiyaki, so I thought
> that was a good sign.
>    I wondered about the geometry on the kissaki and
> would like to see the sugata/shape of the whole
> sword.
> 
> 
> Curran
>
